main event: On 14 July 1952, two airline pilots reported observing six unidentified flying objects near Norfolk, Virginia, while approaching in their DC-4 aircraft.
interesting points: The pilots described the objects as circular, approximately 100 feet in diameter, glowing with an intense amber-red color,The objects moved rapidly, making sharp directional changes at speeds estimated over 1,000 mph,The sighting lasted for about 15 seconds and occurred at an altitude of approximately 8,000 feet,Five jet aircraft from Langley AFB were in the vicinity but confirmed not to be the same objects,The report received significant attention and has been included in various publications on UFOs.
witness description: two experienced airline pilots from Pan American Airways
